casebody.data:
LEVINE v. PENNSYLVANIA R. CO. (Circuit Court of Appeals, Second Circuit. October 24, 1922.) No. 22. Gould & Wilkie, of New York City (R. L. Von Bernuth and Charles G. Keutgen, both of New York City, of counsel), for plaintiff in error. Burlingham, Veeder, Hasten & Fearey, of New York City (Morton L. Fearey and H. H. Breland, both of New York City, of counsel), for defendant in error.

Before ROGERS, MANTON, and MAYER, Circuit Judges.

PER CURIAM.

The judgment in this case is affirmed, in accordance with the former opinion of this court in 263 Fed. 557.
